inset.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a small picture, map etc in the corner of a page or larger picture etc, which shows more detail or information
inset.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The venture earned Mr Taylor (inset) millions of dollars.
inset.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: something which is fixed into or onto the surface of something else
inset.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: a pendant with a diamond inset
inset.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: if something is inset with decorations or jewels, they are fixed into or on its surface
inset.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: a wooden box inset with ivory
inset.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to put a small picture, map etc on a printed page
inset.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: (in-service education training) in the UK, training for teachers which takes place during the school year
